conclusion: Determine the length of the arc AC where light rays cannot directly exit through AB or BC.
ABCO is a square, each side has length R, AC is an arc with radius R, O is the center.
Refractive index of the material is n = 2.
Critical angle θc for total internal reflection is 30°.
Light rays emitted from O will hit the arc AC at various angles.
Find range of angles for which light rays cannot directly exit through AB or BC.
Angle of incidence must be greater than critical angle θc for total internal reflection.
Angle of incidence at AC is measured from the normal to the arc.
Arc AC spans 90° since ABCO is a square.
Range of angles for total internal reflection is from 30° to 90° on either side of the normal.
Total angle range for total internal reflection is 120°.
Length of the arc corresponding to 120° is (2πR)/3.
The length of the arc where light rays cannot directly exit through AB or BC is (2πR)/3.
